meanings.definition: A selection from the Hebrew Bible read publicly in a synagogue as part of the worship service.
meanings.sent1: During the service, the rabbi read the haphtarot aloud for everyone to hear.
meanings.sent2: The congregation listened attentively as the haphtarot was recited.
meanings.sent3: The haphtarot seemed to whisper ancient stories to the walls of the synagogue.
meanings.sent4: As the haphtarot echoed through the room, it felt like history coming alive.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the haphtarot lingered in the air long after the service ended.
